title.value: V2 Table: Alternate Character Set Handling Scheme

description.value: HL7-defined code system of concept that specify the scheme used when any alternative character sets are specified in the second or later iterations of MSH-18 Character Set, and if any special handling scheme is needed. Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging in the MSH segment.

purpose.value: Underlying Code System for V2 table 0356 (Alternate Character Set Handling Scheme, version 2.3.1)

copyright.value: Copyright HL7. Licensed under creative commons public domain

description.value: Version of HL7 in which the code was first defined
Version of HL7 in which the code was deprecated
Whether code is considered 'backwards compatible' (whatever that means)

display.value: The character set switching mode specified in HL7 2.3, sections 2.8.28.6.1, and 2.9.2. Note that the escape sequences used in this mode are "HL7 escapes sequences" as defined in HL7 2.3, sec. 2.9, and do not use the ASCII "esc" character,

definition.value: The character set switching mode specified in HL7 2.3, sections 2.8.28.6.1, and 2.9.2. Note that the escape sequences used in this mode are "HL7 escapes sequences" as defined in HL7 2.3, sec. 2.9, and do not use the ASCII "esc" character,

display.value: This standard is titled "Information Technology - Character Code Structure and Extension Technique". This standard specifies an escape sequence from basic one byte character set to specified other character set, and vice versa. The escape sequence expl

definition.value: This standard is titled "Information Technology - Character Code Structure and Extension Technique". This standard specifies an escape sequence from basic one byte character set to specified other character set, and vice versa. The escape sequence expl

display.value: This is the default, indicating that there is no character set switching occurring in this message.

definition.value: This is the default, indicating that there is no character set switching occurring in this message.
